alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Gillespie; Kendall; Kerr; Medina; Uvalde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 10:02PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Medina, Bandera, Kerr, northeastern Uvalde, southwestern Gillespie and western Kendall Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1002 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Medina, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Medina, Kerrville, Boerne, Comfort, Bandera, Vanderpool, Tarpley, Ingram, Hunt, Walnut Grove, Camp Verde, Bandera Falls, Kerrville-Schreiner Park, Kerr Wildlife Management Area, Waltonia, Pipe Creek, Welfare, Nelson City, Center Point and Utopia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for south central Texas.
